缺.definition: deficiency; lack; scarce; vacant post; to run short of

缺一不可.definition: not a single one is dispensable; can't do without either

缺乏.definition: to lack; to be short of

缺位.definition: (of a position) to fall vacant; vacant post; a vacancy; (of regulation, service etc) unsatisfactory; dysfunctional

缺勤.definition: to be absent from work or school

缺失.definition: lack; deficiency; shortcoming; flaw; defect; to be deficient; to lack

缺少.definition: lack; shortage of; shortfall; to be short (of); to lack

缺德事.definition: misdeed; immoral action; wicked deed; a deliberate wrongdoing

缺德鬼.definition: public nuisance; a wicked, mean spirited individual

缺心眼兒.definition: erhua variant of 缺心眼[que1 xin1 yan3]

缺血.definition: (of an organ) to have insufficient blood supply; (of a blood bank) to run low on blood supplies

缺衣少食.definition: short of food and clothing; destitute

缺角.definition: (of a square shape, such as a house plan) to have a corner missing; (fig.) to lack something; missing piece

缺陣.definition: (sports) to miss a game (due to injury, suspension etc); to sit out a match

缺點.definition: weak point; fault; shortcoming; disadvantage; CL:個|个[ge4]
